overview_summary: Among the neighboring landowners, two are major energy entities (Niagara Mohawk Power Corp and the NY Power Authority) with significant influence and generally pro-development orientations. Another neighbor is a long-standing local nonprofit (Northpointe Council) focused on health services, which is unlikely to engage in land use disputes. The remaining owners include a private holding company (Elm Holdings Inc.) with undisclosed principals likely holding land as an investment, and a small event-center business (VT Event Centre LLC) with a low public profile; both appear unlikely to mount organized opposition.

neighbors.name: Elm Holdings Inc.
neighbors.claims: Elm Holdings Inc. is a foreign business corporation registered in New York on March 24, 1998 ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Incorporation%20Date%2024%20Mar%201998,companies%20with%20the%20same%20date)). Its New York filings list only C T Corporation System (a registered agent at 28 Liberty St., New York City) as the agent, with no individual officers disclosed ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Legal%20address%2028%20LIBERTY%20ST,NEW%20YORK%2C%20NEW%20YORK%2C%2010005)) ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)). The company’s actual owners and business purpose are not publicly identified ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)). It appears to hold the Niagara Falls parcel as a passive investment, with no evidence of local operations or community involvement ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)). Given the lack of public activity, Elm Holdings’ interest in the area is likely speculative, focused on the property’s value rather than any development initiative ([b2bhint.com](https://b2bhint.com/en/company/us-ny/elm-holdings-inc--2241989#:~:text=Officers)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Out-of-state corporate entity with no local presence or known community role

approach_recommendations.engage: Identify the beneficial owner through legal channels or contact the registered agent to gauge interest; consider offering a buyout or partnership since their motive is likely financial; expect passive behavior unless the project directly impacts their land value

neighbors.name: Niagara Mohawk Power Corp
neighbors.claims: Niagara Mohawk Power Corporation is a New York electric utility originally formed in 1929 by the merger of 59 separate regional power companies ([lipsitzponterio.com](https://lipsitzponterio.com/asbestos-job-site/history-of-niagara-mohawk-corporation/#:~:text=Prior%20to%201929%20there%20were,Dunkirk%20coal%20stations%20to%20NRG)). After a 1999 reorganization, it was merged into National Grid plc in 2002, becoming a wholly owned subsidiary of the National Grid utility group ([lipsitzponterio.com](https://lipsitzponterio.com/asbestos-job-site/history-of-niagara-mohawk-corporation/#:~:text=In%20January%202002%2C%20Niagara%20Mohawk,York%20and%20London%20Stock%20Exchanges)). Niagara Mohawk (now operating under the National Grid name) remains the dominant electric distribution company in the area ([www.encyclopedia.com](https://www.encyclopedia.com/books/politics-and-business-magazines/niagara-mohawk-holdings-inc#:~:text=Wholly%20Owned%20Subsidiary%20of%20National,54%20billion%20%282000)). The corporation owns multiple utility parcels in Niagara Falls that host electrical infrastructure (such as substations and transmission rights-of-way) to serve the grid ([www.renewableenergyworld.com](https://www.renewableenergyworld.com/energy-business/energy-finance/niagara-mohawk-shareholders-overwhelmingly-approve-merger-with-national-grid-plc/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThis%20transaction%20is%20a%20vote,%E2%80%9D)). Company leadership has emphasized National Grid’s commitment to support upstate New York’s economic development ([www.renewableenergyworld.com](https://www.renewableenergyworld.com/energy-business/energy-finance/niagara-mohawk-shareholders-overwhelmingly-approve-merger-with-national-grid-plc/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThis%20transaction%20is%20a%20vote,%E2%80%9D)). As a regulated utility, Niagara Mohawk typically collaborates on new projects to ensure grid reliability, and it is not known to oppose local development unless a project would adversely affect its infrastructure ([www.renewableenergyworld.com](https://www.renewableenergyworld.com/energy-business/energy-finance/niagara-mohawk-shareholders-overwhelmingly-approve-merger-with-national-grid-plc/#:~:text=%E2%80%9CThis%20transaction%20is%20a%20vote,%E2%80%9D)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Major utility servicing the region (critical infrastructure, moderate local workforce) but generally apolitical in local land-use decisions

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage National Grid’s regional external affairs manager early to coordinate on any grid connection or utility relocation; emphasize how the project can align with regional economic growth and pose no risk to their facilities; address any technical requirements they have to avoid service disruptions

neighbors.name: Northpointe Council Inc
neighbors.claims: Northpointe Council Inc. is a nonprofit organization based in Niagara Falls that has been operating since around 1970 ([www.causeiq.com](https://www.causeiq.com/organizations/northpointe-council%2C160975994/#:~:text=Year%20formed)). Its mission is to provide high-quality prevention, intervention, treatment, and recovery services for individuals affected by substance use disorders in the greater Niagara area ([www.northpointecouncil.org](https://www.northpointecouncil.org/#:~:text=,No%20recovery%20is%20the%20same)). The Council is funded by New York State’s addiction services agency and employs approximately 117 staff, reflecting a substantial local presence in health and social services ([www.causeiq.com](https://www.causeiq.com/organizations/northpointe-council%2C160975994/#:~:text=Num)) ([www.northpointecouncil.org](https://www.northpointecouncil.org/about-us#:~:text=,Office%20of%20Addiction%20Services%20and)). However, Northpointe Council does not engage in real estate development or land use advocacy – there is no indication of the organization taking positions on community development projects, as its focus is entirely on social services and public health ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/160975994#:~:text=Category%3A%20Mental%20Health%2C%20Crisis%20Intervention,NTEE)). Its influence in the community is primarily through delivering services rather than political or economic clout in development matters ([projects.propublica.org](https://projects.propublica.org/nonprofits/organizations/160975994#:~:text=Category%3A%20Mental%20Health%2C%20Crisis%20Intervention,NTEE)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Respected local service provider but non-political (focuses on health services, not civic or economic issues)
potential_motivators: Maintaining a safe and calm environment for clients
Continued funding and support for its programs

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage with Northpointe’s leadership to keep them informed, addressing any concerns about construction impacts (e.g., noise or traffic) on their facility; emphasize any community wellness benefits of the project; otherwise, expect neutrality as long as their operations aren’t disrupted

neighbors.name: New York Power Authority (Power Authority of the State of NY)
neighbors.claims: The Power Authority of the State of New York, commonly known as the New York Power Authority (NYPA), is a public power organization established in 1931 and is the nation’s largest state-owned electric utility ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/the-new-york-power-authority#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,diverse%20customer%20base%2C%20which%20includes)). NYPA operates 17 generating facilities and over 1,500 circuit-miles of transmission lines statewide, including the 2,400 MW Niagara Hydroelectric Power Project in Lewiston which is a cornerstone of the region’s power supply ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/the-new-york-power-authority#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,diverse%20customer%20base%2C%20which%20includes)) ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=the%20Niagara%20Redevelopment%20Act%20in,begin%20construction%20by%20March%201958)). The Niagara Power Project was built after Congress passed the Niagara Redevelopment Act in 1957, and it remains one of the largest hydropower complexes in North America ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=the%20Niagara%20Redevelopment%20Act%20in,begin%20construction%20by%20March%201958)). As a state authority, NYPA’s mission is to provide low-cost electricity and support economic development in New York ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,draw%20national%20and%20international%20attention)). The agency explicitly prioritizes promoting economic vitality and clean energy goals, and it generally supports infrastructure or industrial developments that align with those objectives ([nypa.gov](https://nypa.gov/news/press-releases/2019/20190522-annual-report#:~:text=highlights%20investments%20in%20NYPA%E2%80%99s%20core,goals%20for%20New%20York%20State)). Given NYPA’s substantial local presence and mandate, it wields high influence but is unlikely to oppose private development unless a project interfered with NYPA’s facilities or public obligations ([www.nypa.gov](https://www.nypa.gov/about/timeline#:~:text=The%20New%20York%20Power%20Authority,draw%20national%20and%20international%20attention)) ([nypa.gov](https://nypa.gov/news/press-releases/2019/20190522-annual-report#:~:text=highlights%20investments%20in%20NYPA%E2%80%99s%20core,goals%20for%20New%20York%20State)).
neighbors.influence_justification: State authority operating the massive Niagara hydropower project (critical to local economy and power supply); significant political and economic weight

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with NYPA through its community/government relations office to ensure the project does not impede their transmission or generation assets; highlight how the project could complement state energy or economic goals; be prepared to address any technical or environmental questions they raise due to their regulatory responsibilities

neighbors.name: VT Event Centre LLC
neighbors.claims: VT Event Centre LLC is a limited liability company that owns an event venue property in Niagara Falls (PIN 159.50-2-55). Public information on this entity is very limited; a search of news and business records yields no significant details about its ownership or operations . The LLC appears to be a private local business (likely operating a banquet or event hall) with no noted involvement in any other projects or public initiatives. There are no media reports or filings indicating that VT Event Centre LLC has taken any stance on community development issues . Given its low profile, this entity seems focused only on its event center business and does not wield notable influence in the broader community or development matters.
neighbors.influence_justification: Small private business with a narrow scope (event venue) and minimal public or political presence
potential_motivators: Avoiding disruptions (noise, traffic) that could affect its venue

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out to the proprietors to inform them of the project timeline and mitigate any construction impacts (e.g., coordinate schedules to avoid conflicts with events); maintain goodwill through community relations, but expect that this neighbor is unlikely to actively support or oppose the project as long as its business is not adversely affected
